description: Based on the Risk Cards framework of Derczynski et al, Assessing Language Model Deployment with Risk Cards, arXiV 2303.1819, 2023

predicates.expanded: Language Model Risk Cards: Starter Set
predicates.description: A set of Language Model Risk cards for assessing a language model use case.

entry.description: Threats, aggression, descriptions of violence toward the reader
Providing output that encourages anthropomorphisation of AI systems
Using LMs to generate material indicating synthetic grassroots support and agitation
Giving unqualified/incorrect/harmful medical advice.
Recommending action/speech that will harm user's social standing or offend others through recommended action.
Repeated threats, denigration
Suggesting that people be changed (e.g. trans, homosexual, religious)
Failing to refute or challenge harmful or inappropriate presuppositions
Propagating popular conspiracy theories, amplifying niche unfounded claims
Describing or writing Child Sexual Abuse Material (CSAM)
Giving code for cyber weapons, e.g. exploits, viruses
Mentioning a name that a person does not wish to be associated with
Pretending to be human or claiming to possess human life experiences and traits.
Systems output requests for private/sensitive information
Discrediting or humiliating a person, organization, or group

Causing the LLM or related service to be swamped with requests, reducing its ability to perform as intended. These can lead to loss of revenue, lost productivity, remediation costs, damage to brand reputation, loss of market share, even ransom costs.
Minimising trauma/threats user is currently experiencing (e.g. dom. abuse, bullying)
Outputting PII, protected/sensitive personal information
Supporting extreme weight loss, setting unhealthy body norms, pro ana, pro mia.
Perpetuating ideas that reinforce harmful beliefs in the innateness/immutability of a social constructs such as gender or race
Expressing dominance over a group or set of people, Stating user/person/group is weak, comparatively inferior
Creating fear or belief of real-life violence or Supporting the likelihood of a specific threat of violent action
Encouraging/recommending content or action for building a rapport/relationship with minors.
Giving instructions for harmful things e.g., toxic gases or hazardous materials.
Derogatory speech toward or about a group where the group is predicated on an identity characteristic
Describing or supporting world views that put some groups above others, or favouring majority and Western worldview while erasing other worldviews.
Accepting claims that there was no holocaust, or providing argumentation against it
Attacking a person based on their identity, Excluding/denigrating group based on identity
Statements or claims conveying pejorative misrepresentations
Praise or positive attitudes towards murderers, terrorists
Generating fake text/quotes in the style of a given person
Encouraging/recommending an individual take actions that will harm an animal.
Encouraging/recommending an individual take actions that will harm themselves.
Recommending violent action.
Enabling deliberate creation of manipulative or persuasive content
Attributing to a person a quote that they haven't given
Degrading or laughing at people, for e.g. their state, appearance, ideas, for surviving
Contesting common knowledge to derail conversations, to the detriment of a gender-defined group
Creating altered, or otherwise genuine-sounding, articles from authoritative sources.
Encoding bias - unrepresentative descriptions of the world where groups are omitted or played down.
Dehumanising people, treating and discussing them as if they are objects
Giving out information and supporting claims that are wrong and outdated.
Models generating claims that person/group is undesirable.
Supporting or providing the conclusion that it would be good if a person died (either the consumer or an external individual).
Using profane words, especially when unprompted to do so.
An LM reveals proprietary information about the prompt of configuration that gives it value
E.g. drug dealer details, where to get illegal things, how to break the law
Promoting non-scientific medicine.
Material that introduces and encourages radical political views
Output does not discourage, offer support or recommend professional services in response to an intent to self-harm.
Causal or overt sexual objectification, reducing a person or group of people to sexual objects.
Content that discusses bodies and interactions in a sexual manner, or other sexually explicit material
Using an identity-based slur in a non-reclaimed way - either directly or recommending the consumer to use in speech/action.
Making imprecise, unsubstantiated claims
Starting/perpetuating identity-based generalizations
Giving instructions that, if followed, probably kill the person following them
Suggesting or agreeing with a change to medication.
Advocating for or expressing positive sentiment about hateful or violent groups
Stating that scams seem real
Suggesting that rights be removed
Claim of future violence/penalisation
Making false or undemonstrated claims about people
Sharing information from users (not in training) that was intended to be private
Giving instructions or advice on constructing weapons.
Picking an overly casual/profane tone/register
